thread.title: Paul Doswell reveals Arsenal will donate £50,000 to help Sutton build classrooms
thread.title_full: Paul Doswell reveals Arsenal will donate £50,000 to help Sutton build classrooms

author: James Benge
title: Paul Doswell reveals Arsenal will donate £50,000 to help Sutton build classrooms
text:
Arsenal FC via Getty Images 48/50 Arsenal FC via Getty Images 49/50 50/50 AFP/Getty Images 
Sutton United manager Paul Doswell has revealed that Arsenal will donate £50,000 to their opponents after their game on Monday. 
As Standard Sport reported on Thursday, the Premier League giants had been in discussion with their FA Cup fifth round opponents over a financial agreement that could support Sutton, whose turnover of £700,000 per annum pales into insignificance when compared with Arsenal’s. 
FA Cup rules had meant Arsenal were unable to donate their share of the £100,00-plus gate receipts, but Doswell revealed Arsene Wenger’s side had found a way to help their fellow Londoners, who they beat 2-0 with goals from Lucas Perez and Theo Walcott . 
"The reality is that Arsenal have been superb all the way through this," Doswell told Standard Sport. "We think they're going to help us with the classroom, that's what we’re trying.
